issue.title: wallet: migratewallet crashes "Assertion `legacy_spkm' failed"
issue.body:
`migratewallet` crashes on malformed `wallet.dat`s which is unlikely to happen with wallets created by old Bitcoin Core versions but we should probably return an error to the user instead of crashing.

<details>

<summary>Base64 encoded `wallet.dat` that causes a crash</summary>

```

```

</details>

```
wallet/wallet.cpp:4085 GetDescriptorsForLegacy: Assertion `legacy_spkm' failed.
AddressSanitizer:DEADLYSIGNAL
=================================================================
==2388446==ERROR: AddressSanitizer: ABRT on unknown address 0x0000002471de (pc 0x7fd9934f7eec bp 0x7fd98d9f26c0 sp 0x7fd98d9f0830 T5)
    #0 0x7fd9934f7eec  (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x8aeec) (BuildId: 79005c16293efa45b441fed45f4f29b138557e9e)
    #1 0x7fd9934a8fb1 in raise (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x3bfb1) (BuildId: 79005c16293efa45b441fed45f4f29b138557e9e)
    #2 0x7fd993493471 in abort (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6+0x26471) (BuildId: 79005c16293efa45b441fed45f4f29b138557e9e)
    #3 0x563bae137c5b in assertion_fail(std::basic_string_view<char, std::char_traits<char>>, int, std::basic_string_view<char, std::char_traits<char>>, std::basic_string_view<char, std::char_traits<char>>) /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/util/./util/check.cpp:34:5
    #4 0x563bad5fb48d in wallet::LegacyDataSPKM*& inline_assertion_check<false, wallet::LegacyDataSPKM*&>(wallet::LegacyDataSPKM*&, char const*, int, char const*, char const*) /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/wallet/./util/check.h:59:13
    #5 0x563bad5fb48d in wallet::CWallet::GetDescriptorsForLegacy(bilingual_str&) const /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/wallet/./wallet/wallet.cpp:4085:10
    #6 0x563bad607a1f in wallet::DoMigration(wallet::CWallet&, wallet::WalletContext&, bilingual_str&, wallet::MigrationResult&) /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/wallet/./wallet/wallet.cpp:4305:48
    #7 0x563bad61923d in wallet::MigrateLegacyToDescriptor(std::shared_ptr<wallet::CWallet>, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, secure_allocator<char>> const&, wallet::WalletContext&, bool) /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/wallet/./wallet/wallet.cpp:4538:23
    #8 0x563bad61206b in wallet::MigrateLegacyToDescriptor(std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, std::allocator<char>> const&, std::__cxx11::basic_string<char, std::char_traits<char>, secure_allocator<char>> const&, wallet::WalletContext&) /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/wallet/./wallet/wallet.cpp:4468:12
    #9 0x563bad3ec469 in wallet::migratewallet()::$_0::operator()(RPCHelpMan const&, JSONRPCRequest const&) const /bitcoin/build_fuzz/src/wallet/./wallet/rpc/wallet.cpp:802:49
```

events.body:
Just to add context, the crash is on an [`Assume()`](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/1d281daf8613a3cb7a26759c351ffb34dab0f656/src/wallet/wallet.cpp#L4087) so it can't happen in a production build, where an unhelpful [error message is printed](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/1d281daf8613a3cb7a26759c351ffb34dab0f656/src/wallet/wallet.cpp#L4089) when this happens. 

This should be caught by `BerkeleyRODatabase::Open()`  which makes [efforts](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/1d281daf8613a3cb7a26759c351ffb34dab0f656/src/wallet/migrate.cpp#L586-L588) to validate the database files on disk during `WalletDatabase` construction, and if it caught this would [result](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/1d281daf8613a3cb7a26759c351ffb34dab0f656/src/wallet/wallet.cpp#L4459-L4462) in the more helpful message: "Wallet file verification failed."

I reproduced this issue in the following manner on a `Release` build of master (1d281daf8613a):

```bash
BAD_DAT=""
mkdir -p /tmp/temp_datadir/regtest/bad_wallet
echo $BAD_DAT | base64 -d > /tmp/temp_datadir/regtest/bad_wallet/wallet.dat

./build/bin/bitcoind -regtest -datadir=/tmp/temp_datadir -daemonwait
./build/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/tmp/temp_datadir migratewallet bad_wallet
```

And the following error message is printed (but the node is still running)

```
error code: -4
error message:
Internal bug detected: Error: Legacy wallet data missing
../../../src/wallet/wallet.cpp:4089 (GetDescriptorsForLegacy)
Bitcoin Core v29.99.0-1d281daf8613
Please report this issue here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues
```

BerkeleyDB 5.3.28's `db_verify` tool reports the following issues with the file:

```console
$ db_verify /tmp/temp_datadir/regtest/bad_wallet/wallet.dat
db_verify: BDB3037 /tmp/temp_datadir/regtest/bad_wallet/wallet.dat: file size not a multiple of the pagesize
db_verify: BDB0567 Page 3: item 4 extends past page boundary
db_verify: BDB0567 Page 3: item 8 extends past page boundary
db_verify: BDB1059 Page 3: gap between items at offset 3980
db_verify: BDB1059 Page 3: gap between items at offset 4012
db_verify: BDB1045 Page 3: item order check unsafe: skipping
db_verify: /tmp/temp_datadir/regtest/bad_wallet/wallet.dat: BDB0090 DB_VERIFY_BAD: Database verification failed
BDB5105 Verification of /tmp/temp_datadir/regtest/bad_wallet/wallet.dat failed.
```
Thanks for reporting this! I've fixed the 'GetDescriptorsForLegacy' crash by adding a null check and better error logging. I'm testing now

I think my comment above was partly mistaken:

There might be two bugs here, the first *potential* bug is that this might be an invalid database file which `BerkeleyRODatabase::Open()` should throw on, and nobody should not even attempt to read records from. The second which is definitely a bug is that we should never be able to get to `GetDescriptorsForLegacy()` when we haven't set up any legacy SPKM's, and AFAICT this file has no legacy wallet records despite being a "legacy" wallet, so `SetupLegacyScriptPubKeyMan()` never happens, so this file exhibits the same behavior as the case described in #32149, and I've tested that #32149 fixes this issue.

---

Also,  `bdb_verify`'s complaint of file size not being a multiple of page size has a [commented out](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/449e2eb7e40f7e14300af92bce8e70a9fde91e1b/src/wallet/migrate.cpp#L549-L551) check in `BerkeleyRODatabase::Open()` that seems to suggest this is not something that should be enforced, but I'm not certain of that.
I've tested that this bug no longer occurs on master doing the same repro steps from [above](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/32112#issuecomment-2750254947)  on a debug build, no crash.
